title: Service Contract: AGVOLUTION GmbH & FED TECH S.R.L
mainPoints: AGVOLUTION GmbH (AGV) engages FED TECH S.R.L (Service Provider) for software development and related services in climate-intelligent agriculture solutions.

The Service Provider will perform project planning (User Stories, SCRUM roadmap, documentation) and programming (SCRUM-based development, ticket processing) for farm management, data science, IoT, and weather data.
This is a freelance service agreement, explicitly not an employment relationship, allowing the Service Provider to work for other clients as long as it does not breach the non-compete clause.
Compensation includes an hourly rate (€24.00 until July 31, 2025, then €27.00) plus a 10% success fee on net customer turnover generated and documented in AGV's CRM, with all fees subject to VAT.

Invoices are monthly, based on hourly documentation, with payment due within 14 days; success fees are paid 14 days after invoicing by the Service Provider and after AGV receives the client's payment.

The Service Provider is responsible for their own taxes and social levies, has no claim to vacation, must maintain strict confidentiality, and is subject to a non-compete clause regarding direct competitors.
The contract starts on March 18, 2025, and can be terminated by either party with four weeks' written notice to the end of a calendar month, with no compensation claims upon termination.
overallSummary: This service contract outlines the engagement of FED TECH S.R.L as a freelance Service Provider for AGVOLUTION GmbH (AGV) to develop software and support sales/marketing in climate-intelligent agriculture solutions. The agreement specifies a project-based, SCRUM-oriented approach for software development, including planning, programming, and documentation.

Compensation is a combination of an hourly rate (starting at €24.00/hour, increasing to €27.00/hour) and a 10% success fee on client turnover generated by the Service Provider. Payment terms are monthly with 14-day invoicing, and the Service Provider is responsible for their own taxes and social contributions.

Important clauses include strict confidentiality, a non-compete obligation, and a clear statement that this is a freelance arrangement without employment benefits. The contract begins March 18, 2025, and can be terminated with four weeks' notice; German law and Hamburg courts govern disputes.
